New Records: India won by seven wickets with 117 balls remaining.
Rohit Sharma scored 86 runs off 63 balls.
Jasprit Bumrah took 2 wickets for 19 runs in his spell.
Shubman Gill took a crucial catch to dismiss Hasan Ali.
Pakistan collapsed from 155-2 to 191 all out, losing 8 wickets for 36 runs.
Key Match Events: Wicket of Rohit Sharma at 86 not out was pivotal.
Pakistan's batting collapse was a turning point.
Bowlers from both teams performed exceptionally well.
Pre-Game Insights: India won the toss and decided to bat first.
Rohit Sharma emphasized the team's strategy to restrict Pakistan's scoring.
Babar Azam reflected on Pakistan's batting approach post-collapse.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma and Jasprit Bumrah were lauded for their performances.
Pakistan's batting collapse was a major topic of discussion.
The match highlighted India's dominance and readiness for the World Cup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was part of the 2023 World Cup.
India extended their unbeaten record against Pakistan in the World Cup.
